data.name: As
data.value: Creates a named alias for the current step of the traversal path. Execution of the traversal path can return to this alias using the [[Back|Func|Back]] function.

data.name: Back
data.value:
Returns the execution of the traversal path to a particular named alias. This alias is created using the [[As|Func|As]] function.
When traversal execution reaches a Back function step, the execution retraces (steps backwards through) the traversal path until the alias is reached. Execution then proceeds using the traversal step(s) that immediately follow the Back function step.
The return type of the Back function is determined by the return type of the corresponding alias. [(EX|Return Type Example|_Traversal Steps_ Get a list of Members: - /!Root/ContainsMemberList/As(M)
Get a list of Artifacts created by those Members: - /!Root/ContainsMemberList/As(M)/CreatesArtifactList
Retrace to the "M" alias, which returns Members: - /!Root/ContainsMemberList/As(M)/CreatesArtifactList/Back(M))]
When execution retraces the traversal path, it does so _only_ from the verts that are currently active at the Back function step. This makes the Back function useful for complex filtering.
[(EX|Retrace Example|_Objective_ Find all the Members of a particular App (AppId = 123) that have created at least one Artifact.
_Traversal Steps_ Create named alias "M" at the Member step: - /!Root/ContainsMemberList/As(M)
Continue traversing to the target App: - /!Root/ContainsMemberList/As(M)/InAppDefines/HasId(2)
Retrace to the Member list, which now contains only Members of "Great App": - /!Root/ContainsMemberList/As(M)/InAppDefines/HasId(2)/Back(M)
Continue traversing to the Artifacts created by these Members: - /!Root/ContainsMemberList/As(M)/InAppDefines/HasId(2)/Back(M)/CreatesArtifactList
Retrace to the Member list, which now also excludes any Members who have not created an Artifact: - /!Root/ContainsMemberList/As(M)/InAppDefines/HasId(2)/Back(M)/CreatesArtifactList/Back(M))]

data.name: Limit
data.value: Restricts the size and starting index of the vertex list. This is typically used as a final traversal step to achieve paging functionality. The Limit function step can be used within a traversal path to filter list results before continuing with traversal execution.

data.name: ToApp
data.value: Restricts the results to include only App verts.

data.name: ToClass
data.value: Restricts the results to include only Class verts.

data.name: HasId
data.value:
Restricts the results to a single Id value.
Note that each vertex type has its own Id property name. For example, a Member has a MemberId and a Factor has a FactorId.

data.name: ToInstance
data.value: Restricts the results to include only Instance verts.

data.name: ToUrl
data.value: Restricts the results to include only Url verts.

data.name: ToUser
data.value: Restricts the results to include only User verts.

data.name: AppId
data.value: Obtains an App by its ArtifactId.

data.name: AppName
data.value: Obtains an App by its entire (case-insensitive) Name.

data.name: AppNameContains
data.value: Search for Apps using string-delimited, case-insensitive tokens. These tokens will be matched against the string-delimited tokens of the Name property.

data.name: ArtifactCreated
data.value: Search for Artifacts by their creation date/time.

data.name: ArtifactId
data.value: Obtains an Artifact by its ArtifactId.

data.name: ClassDisambContains
data.value: Search for Classes using string-delimited, case-insensitive tokens. These tokens will be matched against the string-delimited tokens of the Disamb property.

data.name: ClassId
data.value: Obtains a Class by its ArtifactId.

data.name: ClassName
data.value: Obtains a Class by its entire (case-insensitive) Name.

data.name: ClassNameContains
data.value: Search for Classes using string-delimited, case-insensitive tokens. These tokens will be matched against the string-delimited tokens of the Name property.

data.name: FactorCreated
data.value: Search for Factors by their creation date/time.

data.name: FactorId
data.value: Obtains an Factor by its FactorId

data.name: FactorIdentorValue
data.value: Obtains a Factor by its full (case-insensitive) IdentorValue.

data.name: FactorIdentorValueContains
data.value: Search for Factors using string-delimited, case-insensitive tokens. These tokens will be matched against the string-delimited tokens of the IdentorValue property.

data.name: InstanceDisambContains
data.value: Search for Instances using string-delimited, case-insensitive tokens. These tokens will be matched against the string-delimited tokens of the Disamb property.

data.name: InstanceId
data.value: Obtains an Instance by its ArtifactId.

data.name: InstanceNameContains
data.value: Search for Instances using string-delimited, case-insensitive tokens. These tokens will be matched against the string-delimited tokens of the Name property.

data.name: MemberId
data.value: Obtains a Member by its MemberId.

data.name: MemberTypeAssignId
data.value: Obtains a MemberTypeAssign by its MemberTypeAssignId.

data.name: UrlFullPath
data.value: Obtains a Url by its entire (case-insensitive) FullPath.

data.name: UrlId
data.value: Obtains a Url by its ArtifactId.

data.name: UrlNameContains
data.value: Search for Urls using string-delimited, case-insensitive tokens. These tokens will be matched against the string-delimited tokens of the Name property.

data.name: UserId
data.value: Obtains a User by its ArtifactId.

data.name: UserName
data.value: Obtains a User by its entire (case-insensitive) Name.
